tutorial.speak:
Navigate to the Chums dashboard
Go to settings
Choose Manage
Click the edit pencil in the top right corner
Navigate down to the Giving section and choose Stripe in the Provider box
Go back to your Stripe account and copy your Public and Secret Key and paste them here
The rates are set at the default rate for Stripe. You can negotiate with Stripe and sometimes get these rates reduced. To apply for a nonprofit discount with Stripe, you'll need to confirm your 501(c)(3) status with Stripe and provide proof that at least 80% of your payment volume will be tax-deductible donations. You can then email Stripe nonprofit@stripe.com with your EIN, primary email address associated with your Stripe account, and confirmation of your nonprofit status.
Your donation landing page URL will be: yoursubdomian.b1.church/donation-landing for example: https://ironwood.b1.church/donation-landing. Now you can copy and paste or link your domain wherever you want to take donations.
When you are finished click save.
Now let's go to B1 and set up a donation page on your website. Go to the manager drop down in the top right corner and choose switch app.
Choose B1.Church
Once in B1 choose Admin Portal under your name.
On the left side click on the arrow next to Mobile App and choose Website.
An auto generated page is available to use as you design your website and mobile app.
You can customize this page by clicking on it a converting it to a custom page.
